definitions.definition: One of two usually roughly equal parts into which anything may be divided , or considered as divided.
examples: I ate the smaller half of the apple.
You don’t know the half of it.
Of the passengers on the plane, half were English.
The cake was delicious: half was vanilla and half was chocolate.
I’ve bought some chocolate. You can have half .
One and a half miles equals a mile and a half .

subdefinitions.definition: One of two equal periods into which a game is divided.
examples: An association football match usually consists of two halves of 45 minutes each.

subdefinitions.definition: One of the two opposite parts of the playing field of various sports, in which each starts the game.

definitions.definition: Half of a standard measure, chiefly:

subdefinitions.definition: half a pint of beer or cider.  (Refusing a pint) Just a half , thank you. (Offering to top up a pint glass) Do you want a half in that? (Minimizing the amount of drink taken) A swift half at the Pear Tree.
A barrel measure of 27 gallons (half a hogshead ).

definitions.definition: The fraction obtained by dividing 1 by 2.
examples: Three-quarters minus a quarter is a half .

definitions.definition: Any of the three terms at Eton College , for Michaelmas , Lent , and summer.
A child ticket . Two and a half to Paddington.

main_definition: One of two usually roughly equal parts into which anything may be divided , or considered as divided.
secondary_definitions: Half of a standard measure, chiefly:
( preceded by “a” or a number ) The fraction obtained by dividing 1 by 2.
Any of the three terms at Eton College , for Michaelmas , Lent , and summer.
( UK , dated ) A child ticket . Two and a half to Paddington.
( sports ) abbreviated form for half marathon .
